article:
'Control' is a character from the rock musical Starlight Express. Although it is
never stated one way or the other, it is often assumed that Control is a boy. He
narrates the show, and commentates on the races. Some sources claim that he is a
child of nine years, although there is nothing to confirm this in the show's
libretto. He is from whichever country the show is in(though American in London
as that was fashionable in the 80s - Thunderbirds is another example of an American-
accented British production), who is playing with his trains at the beginning of
the show. His mother comes in and tells him to put his trains away, and get into
bed. He does so, and he dreams that the trains come to life. In the London re-
vamp and subsequent productions Control sneaks out of bed again to continue
playing. Most of his lines are repeated, his catchphrase being 'This is Control,
This is Control' with which he begins all announcements. He has a simple six-
note theme that plays whenever he speaks.

His favorite engine is Greaseball the Diesel. He consistently looks the other
way when Greaseball cheats in the races, and is angry when the plot is wrenched
from his grasp and Greaseball is defeated by unlikely challenger Rusty.

Though he calls himself Control during the show, in some productions he is
listed in the playbill simply as 'The Boy.'
